I know it might sound unusual to take a brief break from the news of the day, but the news of Stan Boreson’s death deserves attention from us in the Pacific Northwest.  Stan was a Northwest TV icon as a host of a local kid’s show in the earlier days of Seattle TV and as a throwback to the area’s Scandinavian settler roots. Stan produced several albums full of pretty corny accordion music sung with that thickly exaggerated Norwegian accent that made “Walking in My Winter Underwear,” into “Valking in My Vinter Undervear,”  all in mocking good fun of the local Scandinavian culture, much like today’s Ylvis songs make fun of today’s Norway.  He was a master of the Ole and Lena jokes with a few about Sven thrown in, the kind of jokes you can only hear today on The Prairie Home Companion during its annual Joke Show.  I met Stan a few times and have an autographed copy of one of his Christmas albums, the one with “Aunt Lena Got Run Over By A Reindeer,” “Here Comes Ingebrit,” and the aforementioned, “Valking in My Vinter Undervear.” His good humor and good nature are in short supply today. It is okay to take a break for a few seconds to mourn his passing and to laugh with your friends at his terrible, funny jokes. I will miss Stanley Boreson.

Once again, Congressional Republicans are attempting to revive #Trumpcare in the #GOPTaxScam and jeopardize access to comprehensive health care for millions of Americans. Under the plan, 13 million Americans would lose health coverage by 2027 and insurance premiums would increase by 10 percent over the next decade. It is time to end the partisan sabotage of the #ACA and work to stabilize the individual market.

The #GOPTaxScam harms seniors and middle-class families in the Pacific Northwest by eliminating the medical expense deduction. Currently, taxpayers can deduct high out-of-pocket medical expenses- such as long term care, dental services and fertility treatments- exceeding 10 percent of their annual income. About 9 million households in the U.S. claim the medical expense deduction, which protects them from potentially bankrupting medical costs.

As a Senior Member of the Transportation and Infrastructure Committee, I know we cannot have a big league economy with little league infrastructure.  That is why I oppose the #GOPTaxScam. Under this plan, the interest on newly issued private activity bonds (PABs) are given to help finance infrastructure projects including roads, bridges, hospitals and airports are terminated. For example, PABs financed infrastructure around Port of Everett and Paine Field. Eliminating PABs would also devastate affordable housing in Washington state. Without PABs nearly 2,100 affordable apartments currently planned by developers across the state would not be built in the next two years. In Snohomish County alone, PABs in combination with housing credits has financed more than 10,000 affordable homes since 1987. Infrastructure cuts to pay for tax breaks for the wealthy? Americans deserve #ABetterDeal.

I stand with my constituents to oppose the #GOPTaxScam that would allow tax-exempt organizations to endorse or contribute to political candidates. The Johnson amendment was passed in 1954 to ensure that charitable or religious institutions could not use donated funds or tax exempt dollars to sway political races. Congressional Republicans’ attempt to remove these protections between church and state could further take politics away from the people, just like the Supreme Court case Citizens United v. FEC. We need to bring politics back to the people. Oppose the #GOPTaxScam.

The #GOPTaxScam threatens our economy and undermines U.S. competitiveness in the global marketplace. Under this partisan plan, hardworking, middle-class Americans would be forced to foot the bill for a $1.5 trillion increase to the national debt, all to benefit corporations and the wealthy.   Experts widely agree that the #GOPTaxScam would increase trade deficits, force the government to borrow more to pay its bills, raise interest rates, and drive down the value of American goods. #ABetterDeal on #taxreform should simplify the tax code, support workers and their families in the Pacific Northwest, robustly invest in infrastructure, and foster more well-paying jobs. More debt, a growing trade deficit, factories moving overseas — that’s no way to make America great.

The #GOPTaxScam would be bad for working families in Washington state, which is why I am voting against the motion to go to conference on this bill. After a few short years, most households that received any temporary relief under this plan would see a spike in the taxes they pay. Those hit the hardest would be middle-class, working families. ‘Nearly two-thirds of people making $54,700 and $93,200 would pay on average $140 more than they currently do, according to an analysis by the nonpartisan Tax Policy Center.’ Further, according to the Center for a Responsible Federal Budget, the deficit under this tax plan would increase by $1.9 trillion over ten years. This plan is wrong for Washington state and wrong for America. I stand opposed to this #GOPTaxScam.

Over 5,700 children in Washington state’s Second District depend on #CHIP for comprehensive, high-quality health care. For years, the state’s Apple Health for Kids program has provided hardworking families in the Pacific Northwest with access to affordable health coverage to ensure that children can learn, grow and thrive. It is inexcusable that Congress continues to delay CHIP reauthorization in favor of working on tax breaks for the wealthy and corporations. I urge Congressional leadership to #ExtendCHIP.

Today, I voted against a bill to override Washington state’s gun laws. H.R. 38 forces Washington to recognize the concealed carry standards of every other state, including those that do not have a permitting process to carry a gun in public.   In the face of tragic shootings, like in Mukilteo, Burlington, and Marysville, reasonable people can disagree on the right steps to take to prevent similar tragedies in the future. But it is clear to me that H.R. 38 fails to make our communities safer and will make it harder for law enforcement officers to do their already difficult jobs.

Did you know the #GOPTaxScam increases the deficit by nearly $1.5 trillion, raids $25 billion from Medicare & denies millions of Americans access to health coverage? All to pay for tax cuts for corporations and the wealthiest Americans. Seniors & families in the Pacific Northwest deserve #ABetterDeal.

I am voting against the tax plan that Republican leaders are forcing through Congress today–it is nothing more than a scam to hurt working families. The true winners of the #GOPTaxScam are corporations & wealthiest Americans, leaving middle class families w/ tax increases. Americans deserve #ABetterDeal.

The House just voted again on the #GOPTaxScam because the first bill was riddled with embarrassing mistakes. It is no surprise that a rushed, poorly designed tax scam would fail to meet Senate procedural rules. Instead of working in a bipartisan way to bring real tax relief to hardworking families, Congressional Republicans forced this bill to the President’s desk – leaving middle-class folks to pay the price for permanent corporate tax breaks. In Washington state, the richest one percent will receive an average $7,750 tax cut under the GOP tax bill, while lower-income Washingtonians face tax hikes.   Americans deserve #ABetterDeal than this. Real bipartisan tax reform should simplify the tax code, support middle-class families and veterans, strongly invest in infrastructure, foster more well-paying jobs, and ensure access to affordable, high-quality health care.

There is a ‘Scrooge’ every holiday season and this year – it’s Congressional Republicans. The best holiday gift Congress could give hardworking families is knowing their children will still have health insurance. However, Congressional Republicans chose to prioritize a greedy tax bill that favors corporations and the wealthiest Americans while vital safety-net programs, like #CHIP, lay in wait for crucial resources.

This week, Congressional Republicans chose to prioritize a major tax break for the super wealthy and corporations. And while Congress takes a break for two weeks, I would like to remind folks that:   1.) There are still 800,000 Dreamers – young people who were raised in this country and have contributed to our economy and communities–in jeopardy of losing their legal status.   2.) 9 million children are threatened with the loss of health insurance because the CHIP program has not been fully reauthorized.  3.) It has been more than two months since funding for Community Health Centers has lapsed – leaving 27 million Americans who rely on these centers with limited access to care.   If Congress does not act soon – millions of Americans in the Pacific Northwest and nationwide will suffer the consequences.
